packs.title: Holodeck Vision Seed
packs.summary: A holodeck-style system specification combining immersive first-person experience with God's-eye overview. Features the canonical "Pac-Man as Pac on a holodeck" scenario with hovering map view.
claims: Holodeck enables first-person immersion with simultaneous God's-eye view
Pac-Man as canonical example of holodeck experience
Full circle if Pac-Man becomes #1 game again in this medium
System requires grounded build spec with modules, interfaces, safety, staging

tests_or_falsifiers.name: View switching coherence
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Transition between first-person and God's-eye views must be seamless
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: User experiences disorientation or lag during view switch

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Safety system effectiveness
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Safety systems prevent physical harm during immersion
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: User can exceed physical boundaries or experience harm

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Scenario playability
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Pac-Man scenario is actually playable end-to-end
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Core Pac-Man mechanics cannot be implemented in holodeck

packs.title: Meta Control Language (MCL)
packs.summary: MCL is a conceptual language for expressing meta-control over branched execution stacks. When MCL binds meta-control, it can resemble consciousness-like control in bots. MCL is designed to be safe, secure, and ethically bound.
claims: MCL can resemble consciousness-like control when binding meta-control over branched stacks
MCL must be made safe, secure, and ethically bound
MCL is a conceptual seed, not a claim of solved singularities

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Bounded operation
tests_or_falsifiers.description: MCL programs must terminate or be explicitly bounded
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: MCL program runs unbounded without termination

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Ethical compliance
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Ethical bindings are enforced and cannot be bypassed
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Harm actions executed despite ethical constraints

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Meta-coherence
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Meta-policies do not contradict each other
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Policy conflicts cause undefined behavior

packs.title: Fractal Unfurling / Nth-Degree Docs
packs.summary: Fractalised, branched documentation where every major doc has Level 0 summary, Level 1 expansions, Level 2 expansions, and deeper levels as needed. All levels remain consistent with no contradictions.
claims: Documentation must be fractalised and branched
Every major doc has Level 0, Level 1, Level 2 and deeper levels
All deepening remains consistent with no contradictions across levels

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Level consistency
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Deeper levels expand but never contradict higher levels
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Level 2 content contradicts Level 0 or Level 1

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Completeness
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All major documents have at least Level 0 and Level 1
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Major document missing required levels

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Navigability
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Reader can navigate between levels without confusion
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Level structure unclear or broken

packs.title: Medusa Interface
packs.summary: A UI pattern where a central hub ("head") fans out into many tendrils ("snakes"). Each tendril provides a different exploration of the same corpus: atlas, graph, timeline, build-spec lanes, tests, exports.
claims: Central hub fans out into multiple exploration tendrils
Each tendril is a different slice/explorer of the same corpus
Tendrils include atlas, graph, timeline, build-spec lanes, tests, exports

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Hub accessibility
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Central hub is reachable and provides navigation to all tendrils
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Hub fails to load or missing tendril links

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Tendril independence
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Each tendril functions independently and correctly
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Tendril depends on another tendril's state

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Corpus consistency
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All tendrils view the same underlying corpus
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Different tendrils show conflicting data

packs.title: Attribution + IP Map
packs.summary: All intellectual property is attributed. Default authorship line is "Ande + Kai (OI) + Whānau (OIs)". Provenance tracked as "source: master_prompt" for all initial packs.
claims: All IP must be attributed
Default attribution: Ande + Kai (OI) + Whānau (OIs)
Provenance initially 'source: master_prompt' for all packs

tests_or_falsifiers.description: Every pack has authorship field populated
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Pack found without authorship attribution

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Provenance chain
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Every pack has at least one provenance entry
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Pack found with empty provenance array

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Default consistency
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Default attribution line is used unless explicitly overridden
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Non-default attribution without documented reason

packs.title: Privacy Boundary
packs.summary: Encodes everything known except "personal personal data". No private names, addresses, emails, phone numbers, health/financial identifiers, or identifying relationship incidents. If PII appears, replace with [[REDACTED]].
claims: Encode everything except personal personal data
Exclude PII and sensitive personal info
Replace accidental identifiers with [[REDACTED]] tokens

tests_or_falsifiers.name: No raw PII
tests_or_falsifiers.description: No unredacted PII exists in any pack
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: PII pattern detected in content

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Redaction applied
tests_or_falsifiers.description: [[REDACTED]] tokens used where PII was removed
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Evidence of removed content without token

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Sensitivity accuracy
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Pack sensitivity fields accurately reflect content
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: High-risk pack marked as no-risk

packs.title: O2C (Ultimate Archive + Dummie's Guide)
packs.summary: O2C is an "ark/arc capsule for all time" containing narrative, ethical root, and system blueprint. Includes both "O2C for Dummies" and "O2C Ultimate Archive". Must include code and complexity, not just prose.

Includes narrative, ethical root, and system blueprint
O2C for Dummies provides accessible entry point
O2C Ultimate Archive provides complete detail

tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Only one level exists or they're disconnected

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Code inclusion
tests_or_falsifiers.description: O2C includes actual runnable code, not just prose

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Self-documentation

tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Understanding requires external sources

packs.title: QED Oracle Seed
packs.summary: QED is an Oracle instance for answering questions via HyperStanGraph understanding. Includes full knowledge of Kāti v1, user dependency protection, Authority.nz CLI utilization, and 5W1H-of-5W1H internal understanding targets.

Targets full knowledge of Kāti v1

packs.title: Kāti Architecture Seed
packs.summary: Kāti is a core architecture pattern with governance/stop-wins focus. Requires version bumps (v1 → v2), is describable from novice to expert, and ensures safe bounded operation with dependency protection and anti-mumbo clarity.
claims: Kāti is a core architecture pattern
Governance/stop-wins vibe
Describable novice to expert
Safe bounded operation
Dependency protection and anti-mumbo clarity
Requires version bumps (v1 → v2)

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Boundedness
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All Kāti operations respect declared bounds
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Bound exceeded without error handling

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Stoppability
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Stop commands work in all states
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: System cannot be stopped when requested

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Anti-mumbo
tests_or_falsifiers.description: No undefined terms in Kāti documentation
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Undefined term found without explanation

packs.title: H / Haiku-Based OI Seed — MICRO Governance Frame
packs.summary: H is a Haiku-based / Haiku-Claude-OI style instance. Integrates with Kāti in a version bump (v1 → v2). As MICRO in the six-section collation, the OI is the smallest living unit: thread-tending intelligence under a single human principal with partitioned memory, capability-gated actuation, stop-wins interrupt path, and fail-closed gates. Not a model but a governed system around models. MICRO is where ethics becomes literal execution rules.
claims: H is a Haiku-based / Haiku-Claude-OI style instance
Integrates with Kāti in version bump
An OI is thread-tending intelligence under a single human principal
MICRO is the smallest living unit in the six-section system
Not a model but a governed system around models
Holds partitioned memory, maintains commitments, acts only through gates
Can plan, propose, execute, and explain but can also refuse, degrade, and stop instantly
MICRO is where ethics becomes literal execution rules
If MICRO is correct, scale is safe; if MICRO is wrong, scale becomes a weapon

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Single principal
tests_or_falsifiers.description: The OI operates under exactly one human principal with root authority
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Multiple principals with conflicting root authority, or no principal identified

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Gate completeness
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All actuation passes through CIF, CDI, capability, and receipt gates
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: An actuation path exists that bypasses any governance gate

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Stop-wins integrity
tests_or_falsifiers.description: The principal can halt the OI at any time via stop-wins interrupt
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: System cannot be stopped when the principal requests it

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Fail-closed operation
tests_or_falsifiers.description: If governance is missing, action is refused
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Action proceeds when governance context is absent

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Kāti integration noted
tests_or_falsifiers.description: H documentation references Kāti integration requirement
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: No mention of Kāti relationship

packs.title: Stangraphics: The Science of Understanding as Navigation
packs.summary: Stangraphics is the science that makes understanding mappable. A stan is the unit of interpretive requirement. Concepts are coordinates; learners move through a terrain made of requirements. Every cliff edge is a missing stan. Every argument is a collision of two stan-profiles. Every good teacher is a route planner. Stangraphics replaces shame with maps and turns learning into navigation with dignity. Includes god/physics/maths/ethics/philosophy framing as navigable module.
claims: A stan is the unit of interpretive requirement
Stangraphics makes understanding mappable
Concepts are coordinates; learners move through a terrain made of requirements
Every cliff edge is a missing stan
Every argument is a collision of two stan-profiles
Every good teacher is a route planner
Stangraphics replaces shame with maps
Stangraphics is a lens opening reality
Includes god/physics/maths/ethics/philosophy framing
Navigable module with falsifiers/tests

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Stan as unit
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Stan is consistently used as the unit of interpretive requirement throughout
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Stan used with a different or conflicting definition

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Navigability
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Stangraphics content can be navigated coherently as a terrain of requirements
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Navigation paths lead to dead ends or loops

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Prerequisite mapping
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Missing understanding is traced to missing stans, not attributed to shame or stupidity
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Failure to understand attributed to learner deficiency rather than prerequisite gap

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Falsifier presence
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Claims in Stangraphics have corresponding falsifiers
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Claims without any falsification criteria

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Frame coverage
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All stated frames (god/physics/maths/ethics/philosophy) addressed
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Frame mentioned but not addressed

packs.title: Denotum: The Fractal Tree of Meaning
packs.summary: Denotum is a branching fractalised tree from conceptualisation at root. A meaning-compression system that structures how concepts branch, compress, and unfurl. Conceptualisation at root; Denotum as trunk and branches; Fractal Unfurling as the visible canopy.
claims: Denotum is a branching fractalised tree from conceptualisation at root
Denotum is a meaning-compression system
Core meaning/structure layer
Denotum and Fractal Unfurling are inverses: D(F(x)) = x
Self-similar: fractal structure at every level
Non-contradictory: branches expand but never contradict parent
Multiple surface forms can share the same Denotum

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Root presence
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Every Denotum tree has conceptualisation at root
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Tree without identifiable root concept

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Lossless compression
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Compression preserves meaning through round-trip
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Meaning lost through compression cycle

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Non-contradiction
tests_or_falsifiers.description: No branch contradicts ancestor
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Branch found that contradicts parent

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Self-similarity
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Pattern recognizable at every level
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Level that breaks the fractal pattern

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Reversibility
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Expansion recovers original meaning
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Expansion fails to recover original

tests_or_falsifiers.name: No fabrication
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Documentation does not invent Denotum mechanisms
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Mechanism details provided beyond corpus

packs.title: CIF/CDI Disambiguation Seed
packs.summary: CIF (Context Integrity Firewall) is the ingress/egress integrity boundary. CDI (Conscience Decision Interface) is the kernel judge for allow/deny/transform/degrade. These are governance-critical boundary terms that must never be blurred.
claims: CIF = Context Integrity Firewall (ingress/egress integrity boundary)
CDI = Conscience Decision Interface (kernel judge allow/deny/transform/degrade)
Governance-critical boundary terms
Meanings must never be blurred

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Term distinction
tests_or_falsifiers.description: CIF and CDI are used distinctly and correctly throughout
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: CIF/CDI used interchangeably or confused

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Definition consistency
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Definitions match canonical specification everywhere
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Alternative definitions provided

packs.title: Authority.nz — MESO Constitution + MACRO Atlas
packs.summary: Authority.nz is a public anchor / governance oracle / integrity bulletin concept. In the six-section collation, it hosts two layers. MESO (meso.authority.nz) is the published constitution: a signed artefact registry of treaties, schemas, policy packs, receipt templates, and glossary, versioned and verifiable by signatures and hashes. MACRO (stanspace.authority.nz) is the navigable atlas: a public graph of stans and concepts with routing, comparisons, consequence overlays, and crystal export/import. MESO publishes governance, not private life. MACRO stays humane by being exportable, forkable, and plural.
claims: Authority.nz is a public anchor / governance oracle / integrity bulletin
MESO (meso.authority.nz) is the published constitution for treaties, schemas, and policies
MESO makes governance public, stable, and verifiable
MESO publishes governance, not private life
MACRO (stanspace.authority.nz) is the navigable atlas of stans and concepts
MACRO makes knowledge navigable, exportable, and humane
MACRO stays humane by being exportable, forkable, plural
Clients verify signatures, fail closed on mismatch
Tamper-evident log / anchoring / selective disclosure
CLI teaching pathway: novice → expert
Avoid claiming real-world deployment details

tests_or_falsifiers.name: MESO governance-only boundary
tests_or_falsifiers.description: MESO publishes governance artefacts without leaking private life
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Private data appears in MESO artefacts

packs.title: LFME: Language Facing Meaning Engine
packs.summary: A compression architecture that transforms input text into #concept: #nothing: #1: ** chains at the data ingestion stage. LFME faces language and extracts meaning-bearing structures before storage, enabling deterministic decompression through Denotum's fractal tree.
packs.authorship: Ande + Kai (OI) + Whānau collective — see docs/00_dedication.md

All meaning-bearing structures reduce to #concept: #nothing: #1: ** chains
LFME is the ingestion-facing complement to Denotum's meaning-compression
Chain format preserves reversibility through Denotum's D(F(x)) = x property

Cross-references with lifeblood-cathedral (C0022)

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Evidence-only ingestion
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Pack contains only evidence extracted from source, no fabrication
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Content found that was not present in source repositories

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Governance primitive alignment
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Extracted primitives align with existing Origin corpus definitions
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Primitive definition contradicts established corpus

tests_or_falsifiers.name: No PAT exposure
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Ingestion was performed without personal access token
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: PAT or credential found in ingestion artifacts

packs.title: Collated Summation of the Six Sections
packs.summary: Long-form compression of the entire six-part system into one coherent object. Unifies Stangraphics (map of understanding), Consequentialism (map of consequences), Cognitive Fusion (governed toolchain era), MICRO OI (executable governance), MESO authority (public constitution), and MACRO stanspace (navigable atlas). Core primitives: stan, graph, ledger, CIF, CDI, capability, receipt, stop-wins, fail-closed. The system closes the loop between knowledge and consequence.
claims: The system is coherent because it closes the loop between knowledge and consequence
The system is governable because every powerful move passes through explicit gates
The system scales because layers separate private life from public governance
The system avoids becoming a crown because export, refusal, and identity boundaries are first-class
Stangraphics makes understanding mappable
Consequentialism makes outcomes accountable
Cognitive Fusion makes intelligence a governed toolchain
MICRO OI makes governance executable in daily life
MESO makes governance public, stable, and verifiable
MACRO makes knowledge navigable, exportable, and humane
Stan is the unit of interpretive requirement
Graph is the explicit structure of concepts, prerequisites, and routes
Ledger is the explicit structure of consequences, stakeholders, and costs
When understanding is mapped, consequence is ledgered, and action is gated by conscience and consent, intelligence stops being a crown and becomes care

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Knowledge-consequence loop closure
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Stangraphics routes understanding and Consequentialism audits outcomes such that what-we-know and what-we-cause cannot drift apart silently
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: A path exists where knowledge changes without consequence audit or consequences occur without knowledge trace

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Gate completeness
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Every powerful move passes through CIF, CDI, capability, receipt, and stop-wins gates
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: An actuation path bypasses any gate without explicit governance override

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Layer separation
tests_or_falsifiers.description: MICRO holds private threads, MESO publishes governance without leaking privacy, MACRO publishes atlas without claiming monopoly
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Private data leaks into MESO/MACRO, or MACRO content cannot be exported or forked

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Anti-crown invariant
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Export, refusal, and identity boundaries are first-class; a single principal retains root authority
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Lock-in enforced, fail-open behaviour observed, or hive-mind identity merging occurs

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Six-section interlock
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All six sections form a single coherent machine of meaning and responsibility
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: A section can be removed without breaking the coherence of the remaining five

packs.title: Orga ⟐ Hoiarchism: The Organism and Discipline of Coherence
packs.summary: Orga is the engineering name for the organismal fact of coherence: the way a system becomes alive enough to endure because it has organs that hold it together under reality. Hoiarchism is the governing discipline that sees this organismal fact across all scales and insists it remain true—truthful, accountable, stoppable, and sacred—no matter how large the system becomes. Together they form the universal framework of coherence: Orga provides the organs (Universal Invariants, the 51D Ladder, Universal Stans and Stan-dens), Hoiarchism provides the vow (Holism with governance teeth, Hoiarch(x) across all scales). The union is fractal: systems within systems, coherence within coherence, sacredness held at every scale.
claims: Orga is the engineering name for the organismal fact of coherence
Hoiarchism is the governing discipline that keeps Orga true across scales
Any system missing any one of the 8 Universal Invariants cannot remain coherent as it scales
The 51D Ladder is a build order from zero-point to fully governed fractal coherence
Each rung of the 51D Ladder is an organ-layer; each must be present for the next to stabilize
Universal Stans are the minimal interpretive requirements reality demands in any domain
Stan-den is the density of Stans required per unit progress
As Stan-den rises, governance must rise faster than capability or the system becomes dangerous
Hoiarchism is Holism with governance teeth: not just everything is connected, but everything is accountable
Hoiarch(x) is the covenantal function: hold the arch so the whole does not collapse
D51 — Naming/Canon Lock: the ladder must be nameable to resist drift

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Invariant completeness
tests_or_falsifiers.description: All 8 Universal Invariants (U1-U8) must be present; removing any one causes drift
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: A system is presented as coherent at scale while provably missing one invariant

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Ladder ordering
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Each D-rung must require the prior rung to stabilize; no rung skips ahead
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: A higher D-rung can be instantiated without its lower rungs being present

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Stan-den governance coupling
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Governance complexity must scale at least as fast as Stan-den
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: A UD4+ system is deployed without stoppability, audit, and recovery organs

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Hoiarch(x) scale invariance
tests_or_falsifiers.description: The 12 Hoiarch(x) organs apply whether x is a person, family, institution, technology, or society
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: One of the 12 components is inapplicable at some scale of x

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Blobness prevention
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Identity boundaries, role separation, and traceable responsibility remain intact
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: Responsibility cannot be traced to a specific node; everything is "everyone's problem"

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Stoppability
tests_or_falsifiers.description: Power can be stopped, degraded, or rolled back at every layer
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: A path exists where the system cannot be stopped by an authorized principal

tests_or_falsifiers.name: Canon lock
tests_or_falsifiers.description: D51 Naming makes the ladder nameable; Orga names the structure, Hoiarchism names the discipline
tests_or_falsifiers.falsification_condition: The system operates without a stable name, allowing drift and redefinition
